conclusion: Need to analyze velocity-time graphs to find when positions become equal.
Graph shows velocity versus time for objects A and B starting at the same location.
Object A's velocity is represented by a triangular pattern.
Object B's velocity follows a curved pattern.
Both objects start with velocity v₀ at t = 0.
Objects meet when they have the same displacement from starting point.
Displacement is calculated as the area under the velocity-time graph.
At t = 0, both objects are at the same position.
From t = 0 to t₂, Object A gains more displacement.
After t₂, Object B's velocity becomes higher than A's.
Objects meet when total area under velocity-time curves is equal.
At t = t₄, Object A's velocity returns to zero.
At t = t₄, Object B's velocity returns to v₀.
Triangular area under Object A's curve from 0 to t₄ equals area under Object B's curve over same interval.
Object A stops moving at t₄, Object B continues moving with velocity v₀.
The two objects meet at time t = t₄.
